Sorry about the low resolution, it's hard to find good maps of Russian provinces (technically federal subjects).
Some description of the parties:
United Russia describes themselves as "conservative" but they are much different than American conservatives, as they are pro-government and generally support a strong centralized government. They could best be described as a party of power, as they really lack much ideology and are mostly centered around Vladimir Putin himself.
The Communist Party is a hardline Stalinist party which wishes to immediately nationalize all natural resources, agriculture and large industry. They are the second largest party in Russia, which isn't saying much.
The Liberal Democratic Party is described as "neither liberal nor democratic". They're actually a quasi-fascist party, being ultra-nationalist and left-wing economically.
The final "major" party in the State Duma, which has no heads of state, is A Just Russia, a broadly centre-left party. (This is probably comparable to the Labour Party in the UK or the Democratic Party in the USA.)
There are also two minor parties in the State Duma (Russian parliament): Rodina (another Russian nationalist party) and Civic Platform (a liberal-conservative party; probably comparable to the Republican Party in the USA or Conservative Party UK.)

WRITING.TITLE: Heads of state of Russian provinces by party [OC] [510x298]
